title: bincoincoreproblem
author: bincoincoreproblem
content: i had installed bitcoin core several years ago.. i installed it on drive d of my computer, while i had windows on drive c. i had security information in a .text file on drive c. my widows had some problems i changed it. all of the files on drive c have removed due to formatting of drive c. now i installed new windows and i forgot my wallet password. on the other hand the text file has removed. i use some recovery programs but i could not solve the problem. please help me and give an efficient solution, please...

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Quote from: bincoincoreproblem on December 06, 2023, 06:37:49 PMi had installed bitcoin core several years ago.. i installed it on drive d of my computer, while i had windows on drive c. i had security information in a .text file on drive c. my widows had some problems i changed it. all of the files on drive c have removed due to formatting of drive c. now i installed new windows and i forgot my wallet password. on the other hand the text file has removed. i use some recovery programs but i could not solve the problem. please help me and give an efficient solution, please...Find a professional data recovery company in your area and seek their help. If you don't know what you are doing, it's best for you not to try anything more.

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Do you still have the wallet.dat file on the drive D?If you still have the wallet.dat file you can brute-force the wallet only if you still remember your password partially.Or hire a professional who can recover your wallet check this site walletrecoveryservices.com

comments.author: BenCodie
comments.body: Quote from: BitcoinGirl.Club on December 06, 2023, 06:43:06 PMQuote from: bincoincoreproblem on December 06, 2023, 06:37:49 PMi had installed bitcoin core several years ago.. i installed it on drive d of my computer, while i had windows on drive c. i had security information in a .text file on drive c. my widows had some problems i changed it. all of the files on drive c have removed due to formatting of drive c. now i installed new windows and i forgot my wallet password. on the other hand the text file has removed. i use some recovery programs but i could not solve the problem. please help me and give an efficient solution, please...Find a professional data recovery company in your area and seek their help. If you don't know what you are doing, it's best for you not to try anything more.This is the best option. There are many specialists who can dive deeper than recovery programs that you might be trying OP.Quote from: BitMaxz on December 06, 2023, 06:49:05 PMDo you still have the wallet.dat file on the drive D?If you still have the wallet.dat file you can brute-force the wallet only if you still remember your password partially.Or hire a professional who can recover your wallet check this site walletrecoveryservices.comOP just so that you are aware, this will probably only work if you know some of the password or if the password is short (depending on your computer power). The more of the password that you know, the less time it will be likely to take to find the right password. If you take this route, there are some open source tools to help you efficiently give this a go.

comments.author: nc50lc
comments.body: Quote from: bincoincoreproblem on December 06, 2023, 06:37:49 PM-snip- now i installed new windows and i forgot my wallet password. on the other hand the text file has removed. i use some recovery programs but i could not solve the problem.Follow the first reply because what you've already done potentially destroyed the data that you want to recover from that drive.What I mean is when you've installed the new OS or recovery program, it may have been written on top of that .txt file.Even using the PC alone can overwrite those data since an OS isn't just all read process.Quote from: bincoincoreproblem on December 06, 2023, 06:37:49 PMi had installed bitcoin core several years ago.. i installed it on drive d of my computer, while i had windows on drive c.How about the data directory?If you had been using the default, then it was also saved in C:/Because you may have a bigger issue than a lost password if your wallet.dat file is also wiped.BTW, how've you been starting Bitcoin Core after installing a new Windows? (do not try this now since it counts as using the disk)Directly starting bitcoin-qt.exe?Through a shortcut with command line option like -datadir?Using cmd or PowerShell?
